publications.name: Examining the Doctrine of Discovery in Religion and Indigenous Studies
publications.summary: Co-author with Betty Hill. Analyzes the matrix of enslavement, exploitation, and extraction within settler-colonial systems and examines scholarly engagement with the Doctrine of Discovery across Religious Studies, Legal Studies, and Indigenous Studies.

publications.name: Healing the Sacred: The Fight to Restore Onondaga Lake and Honor Indigenous Land
publications.summary: Co-author with Betty Hill (Lyons). Examines environmental restoration and Indigenous land rights in the context of Onondaga Lake.

publications.name: Documenting Domination in International Relations Through the Doctrine of Discovery
publications.summary: Co-author with Betty Hill. Discusses AILA's work to dismantle the Doctrine of Discovery through international advocacy and collaboration, emphasizing the shift from rights-based to responsibility-based approaches.

publications.name: Book Notes: New Books in the Study of Domination
publications.summary: Co-author with Betty Hill. Reviews books on domination, including works on Indigenous values, African Diaspora religions, and systemic oppression.

publications.name: 200 Years of Johnson v. M'Intosh: Indigenous Responses to the Religious Foundations of Racism
publications.summary: Co-author with Philip P. Arnold and Sandra Bigtree. Examines the religious foundations of racism through analysis of the Johnson v. M'Intosh decision.

publications.name: The Religious Origins of White Supremacy and The Doctrine of Christian Discovery
publications.summary: Co-author with Philip P. Arnold and Sandra Bigtree. Explores the theological and historical foundations of white supremacy through the Doctrine of Christian Discovery.

publications.name: Documenting Domination: From the Doctrine of Christian Discovery to Dominion Theology
publications.summary: Co-author with Betty Hill (Lyons). Traces the genealogy of Christian domination from fifteenth-century papal bulls through contemporary Christian nationalist theologies, analyzing colonial charters and primary sources.

publications.name: On the Limits of the Concept of Religious Freedom in Indigenous Communities
publications.publisher: Journal of the Council for Research on Religion
publications.summary: Co-author with Betty Hill (Lyons). Critiques international legal framings of religious freedom, highlighting limitations in rights-based discourse and offering alternatives based on sovereignty and Two Row Wampum principles.

publications.name: Preface and Introduction: From Indigenous Religions to Indigenous Values Vol. 5 No. 2
publications.publisher: Journal of the Council for Research on Religion
publications.summary: Co-author with Philip P. Arnold and Sandra Bigtree. Introduces special issue on Indigenous religious freedom and belief, featuring contributions from Indigenous NGOs, nations, and leaders.

publications.name: Digital Humanities as Preserving Inherently Ephemeral Information
publications.publisher: Bulletin for the Study of Religion
publications.summary: Explores the role of digital humanities in preserving ephemeral information and knowledge systems, particularly relevant to Indigenous scholarship.

publications.name: However, Extravagant The Pretensions Of Johnson V. M'Intosh
publications.publisher: Canopy Forum: On the Interactions of Law and Religion
publications.summary: Co-author with Betty Hill (Lyons). Peer-reviewed article examining Johnson v. M'Intosh and its legal and religious implications.

publications.name: Introduction to 200 Years of Johnson v. M'Intosh: Law, Religion, and Native American Lands
publications.summary: Co-author with Philip P. Arnold and Sandra Bigtree. Introduction to thematic series examining 200 years of Johnson v. M'Intosh, its legal foundations, and religious origins.

publications.name: Reavers ain't men [sic]--or they forgot how to be: Teaching Religion in Science Fiction
publications.summary: Explores pedagogy and methodology for teaching religion through science fiction narratives, examining themes of humanity, identity, and religious meaning.

publications.name: Religion and culture: contemporary practices and perspectives (Book Review)
publications.summary: Review of contemporary practices and perspectives in the study of religion and culture.

publications.name: The world's religions: a contemporary reader (Book Review)
publications.summary: Review of contemporary reader on world religions.

publications.name: Religious and Sexual Nationalisms in Central and Eastern Europe (Book Review)
publications.summary: Review of 'Religious and Sexual Nationalisms in Central and Eastern Europe: Gods, Gays and Governments' by Sremac and Ganzevoort.

publications.name: Catastrophic Christianity: An Iconological Study of the Messianic Idea in American Protestant Christianity Circa 1900-1940
publications.summary: PhD Dissertation. Analyzes the messianic idea in America through four case studies examining fundamentalism, authoritarianism, commodification of religion, and hucksterism in early 20th century U.S. culture.

editorialWork.title: "We Were Planting Corn and They Were Planting Crosses": Commodifying the Sacred in Johnson V. M'Intosh
editorialWork.summary: Edited volume examining the commodification of the sacred and Indigenous lands through the Johnson v. M'Intosh decision.

editorialWork.title: 200 Years of Johnson v. M'Intosh: Law, Religion, and Native American Lands
editorialWork.summary: Guest edited special thematic series exploring law, religion, and Indigenous rights in the context of Johnson v. M'Intosh.
